message: I've been searching for a solution for the unstyled Typo3 backend and found you had the same problem. Did you manage to find a solution? Thanks!
@Northwings For me it had to do with gzip-compression and an old cache. Try altering or adding the following line to your typo3conf/localconf.php: $TYPO3_CONF_VARS['BE']['compressionLevel'] = '0';
Then remove all files in typo3conf named like: temp_CACHED_*

So I turned gzip compression off with that. Second thing todo is disable it in the .htaccess. Near the end of the file make sure lines starting with mod_gzip_item_exclude are prefixed with a #. And line `<FilesMatch "\.js\.gzip$">` untill line `AddEncoding gzip .gzip` are prefixed with a # as well.
In my last sentence about clearing all cache I meant the Typo3 cache.

Clear all browser cache and/or restart your browser. Then reload the Typo3 backend, it should be better now, did it work for you? Otherwise try logging in and see it worked. Try clearing all cache and try again.

In the TYPO3 Wiki i found a note on this topic. It's there in the upgrade-to-4.4-area, but i guess the solutions are the same: 
http://wiki.typo3.org/wiki/Upgrade#Notes_3
The solutions are the same yes. Although the wiki has a bit more things you could check.

Thanks for the info. The compressionLevel was already at 0 but the htaccess file didn't have the `<FilesMatch "\.js\.gzip$">` prefixed untill the line  `AddEncoding gzip .gzip` which I did. Even doing that didn't fix the backend. This is really strange

@Northwings Hmm okay, strange. Have you tried loading the backend in another browser? Just to be sure all browser cache was cleared. You could also try renaming the typo3temp directory and create a new and empty directory with full write access.
Well, I updated the t3skin extention and that solved the problem. Thanks for your help!
Aha allright good to know. Np.
Also, thanks for posting your solution :)
